Definition: A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur, a short snout, and retractile claws.
A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, non-retractable claws, and a barking, howling, or whining voice.
The star around which the earth orbits.
The natural satellite of the earth, visible (chiefly at night) by reflected light from the sun.
A woody perennial plant, typically having a single stem or trunk growing to a considerable height and bearing lateral branches at some distance from the ground.
A building for human habitation, especially one that consists of a ground floor and one or more upper storeys.
A colorless, transparent, odorless, tasteless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain and is the basis of the fluids of living organisms.
A written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together along one side and bound in covers.
A road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an internal combustion engine or electric motor and able to carry a small number of people.
An electronic device for storing and processing data, typically in binary form, according to instructions given to it in a variable program.
A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, providing a level surface for eating, writing, or working at.
A separate seat for one person, typically with a back and four legs.
A solid or hollow spherical or egg-shaped object that is kicked, thrown, or hit in a game.
A telephone.
A powered flying vehicle with fixed wings and a weight greater than that of the air it displaces.
An opening in the wall or roof of a building or vehicle that is fitted with glass or other transparent material in a frame to admit light or air and allow people to see out.
A hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier at the entrance to a building, room, or vehicle, or in the framework of a cupboard.
A system for transmitting visual images and sound that are reproduced on screens, chiefly used to broadcast programs for entertainment, information, and education.
A piece of furniture for sleep or rest, typically a framework with a mattress and coverings.
A device for giving light, either one consisting of an electric bulb together with its holder and shade or cover, or one burning gas or oil and consisting of a wick or mantle and a glass shade.
A mechanical or electrical device for measuring time, indicating hours, minutes, and sometimes seconds, typically by hands on a round dial or by displayed figures.
A separate seat for one person, typically with a back and four legs.
A solid or hollow spherical or egg-shaped object that is kicked, thrown, or hit in a game.
A telephone.
A powered flying vehicle with fixed wings and a weight greater than that of the air it displaces.
An electronic device for storing and processing data, typically in binary form, according to instructions given to it in a variable program.
A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, providing a level surface for eating, writing, or working at.
A colorless, transparent, odorless, tasteless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain and is the basis of the fluids of living organisms.
A written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together along one side and bound in covers.
A road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an internal combustion engine or electric motor and able to carry a small number of people.
The star around which the earth orbits.
The natural satellite of the earth, visible (chiefly at night) by reflected light from the sun.
A woody perennial plant, typically having a single stem or trunk growing to a considerable height and bearing lateral branches at some distance from the ground.
A building for human habitation, especially one that consists of a ground floor and one or more upper storeys.
A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur, a short snout, and retractile claws.
A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, non-retractable claws, and a barking, howling, or whining voice.
An opaque white fluid rich in fat and protein, secreted by female mammals for the nourishment of their young.
An oval or round object laid by a female bird, reptile, fish, or invertebrate, usually containing a developing embryo.
Moisture condensed from the atmosphere that falls visibly in separate drops.
Any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink or that plants absorb in order to maintain life and growth.
A person with whom one has a bond of mutual affection, typically one exclusive of sexual or family relations.
A group consisting of two parents and their children living together as a unit.
An intense feeling of deep affection.

A condition of body and mind that typically recurs for several hours every night, in which the nervous system is relatively inactive, the eyes closed, the postural muscles relaxed, and consciousness practically suspended.
A series of thoughts, images, and sensations occurring in a person's mind during sleep.
Form one's features into a pleased, kind, or amused expression, typically with the corners of the mouth turned up and the front teeth exposed.
Make the spontaneous sounds and movements of the face and body that are the instinctive expressions of lively amusement and sometimes also of derision.
Shed tears, typically as an expression of distress, pain, or sorrow.
Make musical sounds with the voice, especially words with a set tune.
Move rhythmically to music, typically following a set sequence of steps.
Move at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time.
Push oneself off a surface and into the air by using the muscles in one's legs and feet.
Engage in activity for enjoyment and recreation rather than a serious or practical purpose.
The devotion of time and attention to acquiring knowledge on an academic subject, especially by means of books.
Gain or acquire knowledge of or skill in (something) by study, experience, or being taught.
Activity involving mental or physical effort done in order to achieve a purpose or result.
Mark (letters, words, or other symbols) on a surface, typically paper, with a pen, pencil, or similar implement.
Look at and comprehend the meaning of (written or printed matter) by mentally interpreting the characters or symbols of which it is composed.
Say something in order to convey information, an opinion, or a feeling.
Give one's attention to a sound.
Produce (a picture or diagram) by making lines and marks, especially with a pen or pencil, on paper.
Cover the surface of (something) with paint, as decoration or protection.
The property possessed by an object of producing different sensations on the eye as a result of the way the object reflects or emits light.
Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment.
Feeling or showing sorrow; unhappy.
Having a strong feeling of or showing annoyance, displeasure, or hostility; full of anger.
Feeling or showing mild astonishment or shock.
Very enthusiastic and eager.
In need of sleep or rest; weary.
Afraid of something; frightened.
Ready to face and endure danger or pain; showing courage.
Having or showing a friendly, generous, and considerate nature.
Having or showing a quick-witted intelligence.
Causing laughter or amusement; humorous.
Pleasing the senses or mind aesthetically.
Unpleasant or repulsive, especially in appearance.
Of considerable size or extent.
Of a size that is less than normal or usual.
Moving or capable of moving at high speed.
Moving or operating, or designed to do so, only at a low speed; not quick or fast.
Having a high degree of heat or a high temperature.
Of or at a low or relatively low temperature, especially when compared with the human body.
Covered or saturated with water or another liquid.
Free from moisture or liquid; not wet or moist.
Of great weight; difficult to lift or move.
Of little weight; easy to lift.
To be desired or approved of.
Of poor quality or a low standard.
In accordance with what is good, proper, or just.
Not correct or true; incorrect.
In accordance with fact or reality.
Not according with truth or fact; incorrect.
Produced, introduced, or discovered recently or now for the first time; not existing before.
Having lived for a long time
